# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the SMES unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the substation unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check the APC unit's current Load* (W).
## 1.2. P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit
- Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is fueled. For extended flights make sure that you have enough fuel stockpiled to sustain prolonged power generation. - Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is set to HV output. - Set Target Power to 16 [bold]kW[/bold] on the generator unit. - Start P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit.
## 2. Atmospherics
- Check if the O2 canister and N2 canister are anchored to their connector ports. - Check if the gas mixer has its mixing ratio and output pressure set correctly. - Check that the gas mixer is set to the appropriate ratios for the shuttle's inhabitants. - Enable the gas mixer.
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the blast doors are closed.
## Sidenotes
* - Siphon-Class vessels come equipped with emergency back-up solar collectors. Consult a certified engineering professional for troubleshooting.
